availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John A. Brooks (Hopkins + Webster Co. clerk, notary public + attorney )

body.p: Hopkins County and Webster County, Kentucky, clerk, notary public, and attorney. Kentucky native. Son of Nathaniel M. Brooks and Virginia Brooks. Married to Nannie A. Rice in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1861. Student in Hopkins County in 1850. Clerk in Hopkins County in 1860. Notary public in Webster County in 1861. Attorney in Dixon in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 113B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 692.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hopkins County Marriages, Film #000568132, p. 42.
U.S. IRS Tax Assessment Lists, 1862-1918, Kentucky, 1865, Collection District 1, Division 12, p. 19.
Journal of the Adjourned Session of 1865-6, of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, (Frankfort, Ky.: John H. Harney, Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 201-02.
KYR-0001-017-0062.
